body.name: 5 in 1 STEM Model Car Kits, STEM Projects for Kids, Boys Toys Age 8-12, 3D Wooden Puzzles, Crafts Educational Science Building Kit, Christmas Birthday Gifts for 8 9 10 11 12 Year Old Boys and Girls
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 20 hrs 26 mins
features: A Great Gift for Kids: The STEM Kit comes with all of the parts you need to build wind-power car, solar car, balance car, gear car, wireless remote control car. This STEM project is a great gift for boys and girls.
High Quality: These 3D wooden puzzles are precise laser pre-cut , the edges of each component have a smooth finish can be tightly integrated, easy to assemble.

Unique design: These STEM projects can be painted and decorated with 12 colors of paint and 2 brushes included in this set, making them unique handicrafts that are perfect for displaying on tables, shelves, or display cabinets in children's bedrooms, playrooms, or study areas.

Stimulate children’s interest and curiosity: With various 3D wooden puzzles, gears, plates, tires ,shaft and screws for children to assemble 5 different styles of car! Kids will be excited and proud of their own model that actually moves.

Cultivate Creativity and Imagination:By assembling this wooden building kit, children can develop their hand - eye coordination, stimulate imagination and promote their physical and intellectual development.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These were fun for my grandsons they do however need help building them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hands On Building Det
reviews.reviewText: My bright, dexterous grandson aged 7 already enjoys challenging Legos and transformers. This Stem -based set will appeal to him and his Dad for shared fun on snowy days.I like that the completed builds can be displayed on a shelf or mantel in their large playroom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun STEM Kit!!
reviews.reviewText: Each kit came with instructions, tools, and all the parts needed for assembly. Overall, my teenager really enjoyed this kit. The instructions were straight forward and including debugging suggestions at the end. There was a lot of trouble shooting involved, but in a good way!He's assembled 4 out of the 5 builds so far and this is our experience:Wind Powered Car: This was one of the easiest to assemble. We had a user error and were able to correct it by reading the debugging suggestions at the end.Wireless RC Car: We couldn't get it to work. It would sporadically move on its own. We triple checked and everything is in the right place. We think the PCB board may be defective.Solar Powered Car: This issue with this one is that the battery pack was defective, one of the wires wasn't connected. We replaced that battery pack with the one from the RC Car and then it worked. It moves very slowly without sunlight. With sunlight, there was slightly more power. In the end, it worked!Balance Car: This build process was pretty smooth. We LOVE that it came with googly eyes. We're still working on the balancing aspect. It has a lot of power and would spin in circles until it hit a wall and then proceed to drive straight at a very high speed until it crashes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great item that keeps kids busy!
reviews.reviewText: I really loved how organized this item came. Each set came nicely packaged and separated so there was no confusion on what to put together. I like how busy this keeps my son. He is still working on these little by little. We like all the steps and customization that goes into this. For homeschooling mamas this can go towards art and science lessons! Painting and stem all in one! This is a well thought out kid, and we would purchase other sets in the future!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great STEM learning - and fun!
reviews.reviewText: I'm always looking for fun AND educational toys for my grandchildren, especially my oldest grandson. I often find them inappropriately marked with "recommended age level" - usually much easier than indicated.This pack includes 5 kits, sure to maintain interest. If one is too easy or difficult, others will catch his interest until he grows into the others through experience and interest.The packaging is unique - each of the kits arrived in its own plastic bag with balsa wood punch-out pieces, mechanical or electrical components, connectors or screws, and instructions.All items are of decent quality and should last through many rounds of play - as long as the builder/owner remains calm. Once assembled, each item continues to educate with experiments and play.The instructions! Wonderfully clear, two pages (front and back with clear photos showing each step). A short but helpful "problem resolution" section will help get over major issues. The final two sections provide fun teaching moments- "Science Tips" and "Think about it" (an open-ended question to encourage cementing of knowledge gained through the project. Reading and understanding these will require (grand)parental assistance, especially for early readers. (My only issue is the small type font - readable but requires decent lighting and plenty of squinting!)Great gift to explore together!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Okay projects, not all work the way they're supposed to
reviews.reviewText: I was really excited to give these STEM projects to my 7-year-old son for his birthday. The projects themselves are okay - they definitely require some adult help for a kiddo his age. Once the projects are done, they look pretty cool, but the disappointing part is that they don't really work the way they're supposed to. For example, we built a battery powered airplane that was supposed to use its propeller to move across the ground, and while the propeller did work, it didn't move the plane at all. Overall, these are cute projects, but they're not functional.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun little science kit
reviews.reviewText: We built the fighter jet so far and it was great. It took about 10 minutes to get the plane done with the help of a parent, and the kid enjoyed it. It is very simple and easy to build (though some of the wood notches didn't line up perfectly). The structure of cars and planes are on wood cutouts, and there's a simple motor get the cars moving. Each kit is individually packaged and the instructions were clear enough. I like how there's paint to add color to your finished pieces. Each of the pieces require 2x AA to get the motor running. This kit makes a great gift for a young child who loves building (and destroying) things.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smaller than expected
reviews.reviewText: The projects were great to get the little ones minds going and spark enough curiosity to get started and enough fun to see it to completion (even if it was me finishing lol!). Overall I liked the kit and all of the different options. I would say the only downside is that the resulting toys are a bit smaller than I expected
